Vaonis Vespera 智能望远镜让您可以比以往更轻松地使用iPhone观察夜空，但成本高昂。

Vaonis Vespera 望远镜作为一款由应用程序控制且易于携带的望远镜，为天文摄影带来了自动化感，人们无需具备望远镜经验即可使用。通过 Terry Virts 和 Scott Kelly 的签署，我们可以看到，即使是宇航员也看到了软件和机器人技术如何塑造天文摄影的未来。

开箱即用，望远镜配有一个短的可调节三脚架、一根 USB-C 电缆和一个适配器。三脚架腿可以用螺丝固定，磁性充电器让您可以在旅途中使用移动电源轻松为 Vespera 供电。

Vespera 重约 11 磅，足够小，可以放入大多数背包甚至较小的斜挎包中。这使得携带它去公园或徒步旅行观察夜空比大多数其他望远镜更容易。

Stellaris 应用程序使用 GPS 来设置您的观察位置，同时考虑地球的自转并调整其自动对焦功能，以消除用户的手动调整。您所要做的就是设置 Vespera 及其三脚架腿，打开应用程序，然后选择您想要观察的内容。

Vespera 将打开其望远镜臂，旋转并调整其角度以观察天空。

Vaonis Vespera 智能望远镜 - 应用程序和使用

启动 Vespera 需要通过 WiFi 连接到它，初始化过程可能需要大约五到十分钟来扫描天空以寻找可观察的可行物体。

尽管如此，我们建议您将 Vespera 设置在大型开放环境中。拥有许多树木的小院子并不理想，而开阔的场地可以最大限度地扩大望远镜提供的运动范围。

Singularity 应用程序会告诉您观察某个物体需要多长时间，并且估计值在五到十分钟内就可以很好地保持。

根据周围环境的不同，如果有东西阻挡了望远镜的视野，初始化或观察可能会失败，因此需要进行一些尝试和错误才能获得成功的图片。使用 Vespera 时需要耐心，因为重新初始化并再次设置观察可能需要一段时间。

电池电量充足，可以进行一整夜的观星，据称可以自动运行八小时。平均而言，三十分钟的观察会消耗 5% 的电池电量，因此八到十小时的范围是合理的。

在我们有限的天文摄影经验中，Vespera 捕捉到了清晰且令人满意的图像。根据天体的接近程度，亮度和清晰度可能会有所不同。

例如，我们发现环形星云比漩涡星系更容易捕捉到。当然，质量也可能取决于用户的环境。

Vespera 捕捉到的环形星云

图像可以以 1920x1080 分辨率导出为多种格式，包括 JPG、TIFF 和 FITS。如果您想与其他人分享结果，那么能够轻松地将结果保存到手机上是很有吸引力的。

Vespera 上的两种模式特别利用了它不知疲倦地拍照的能力：马赛克模式和“计划我的夜晚”。马赛克模式会捕获天空的多个快照并将它们组合起来，这可能比通常的观察花费更长的时间。

然而，“计划我的夜晚”允许用户使用 Vespera 提前观察整个晚上的不同物体。如果您将望远镜留在草坪上或在露营旅行期间，就可以在睡眠中研究星星。

iPad 上显示的“计划我的夜晚”功能。

由于 Vespera 具有自动化功能和可长时间在户外使用的功能，因此具有 IP43 防水等级，因此允许轻微的溅水和雨水。

不过，我们会避免太多的暴露，并留意天气，以防你把它放在外面过夜。

朝着无障碍的正确方向迈出了一步

Vespera 望远镜作为一种工具具有很大的潜力，可以让天文摄影变得更加容易。通过在教育和太空爱好者中的应用，Vespera 以易于理解的方式介绍了捕获天体的复杂性。

通过使用 Singularity 应用程序，用户可以随心所欲地了解夜空并与之互动。 Vespera 提供了一种开展个人爱好或与他人分享经验的绝佳方式。

相比之下，入门级望远镜的起价为 100 至 500 美元，这只是 Vespera 1,499 美元成本的一小部分。值得关注的主要特点是自动化和易用性，以及小尺寸和便携性。

尽管如此，如果您想迈出一步并且缺乏操作望远镜的经验，那么这是一项值得的投资。

Vaonis Vespera 智能望远镜专业版

  • 高度便携
  • Stellaris 应用程序简化了设置和观察
  • 良好的电池寿命和防水性
  • 利用自动化的不同功能

Vaonis Vespera 智能望远镜的缺点

  • 高成本可能是一种阻碍
  • 捕获图像的亮度和清晰度可能会有所不同
  • 根据周围环境，初始化和观察可能会突然失败

评分：3.5 分（满分 5 分）

Vaonis Vespera 智能望远镜在Vaonis 商店有售，售价 1,499 美元（另加 90 美元美国运费）。

; Sun, 09 Jul 2023 22:03:22 GMT https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/07/09/vaonis-vespera-smart-telescope-review-automation-for-telescopes https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/07/09/vaonis-vespera-smart-telescope-review-automation-for-telescopes Thomas Sibilly Kinsa QuickScan thermometer review: Simple and accurate

Kinsa Health 的 QuickScan 温度计和应用程序提供简单而准确的温度、症状和社区健康跟踪 - 但该应用程序存在一些错误。

拥有一个准确且易于使用的温度计是必须的，尤其是在流感季节来临时。我们想知道智能温度计与过去的水银玻璃温度计相比是否是升级版。

Kinsa Health 于 2012 年成立，其使命是通过使用技术遏制传染病的传播。十年后，这些智能温度计变得无处不在，以至于许多学校都需要它们作为返校购物清单。

Kinsa 的 QuickScan 温度计是一款非接触式设备，可通过蓝牙从您的手机连接到免费的 Kinsa 应用程序。这使您可以将家人的健康数据以及匿名本地更新汇总到一处。

温度计可以在几秒钟内测量出您的体温，这肯定比在舌下放置玻璃温度计坐几分钟要好。我们测试了 Kinsa 的 QuickScan 温度计，以确定它是否值得在药柜中永久放置。

Kinsa Health QuickScan 温度计 - 设计

QuickScan 温度计采用迷人的蓝白色设计。外部由软塑料制成，边缘倾斜，握持舒适。

它包括一键式按钮、带有表情符号的发烧级别指示以及易于阅读的背光显示屏。它重六盎司，手感时尚。它由随附的两节 3A 电池供电。

设备背面是检测红外辐射的传感器。像这样的非接触式温度计的工作原理是测量物体发出的红外辐射量。

当然，非接触式温度计在疫情期间变得流行。希望保持良好公共卫生的企业和学校将继续受益于该温度计的非接触式设计。

Kinsa 非接触式温度计使用红外线来检测额头温度

温度读数会在两秒内显示在设备和应用程序上。我们欣赏的是，尽管它是非接触式温度计，但设备背面触感柔软，以防传感器在使用过程中意外擦伤额头。

我们将 QuickScan 与水银口腔温度计进行比较，发现读数相同。我们发现 QuickScan 同样准确。

Kinsa Health QuickScan 温度计 - 需要灯光设置和应用程序配对

与大多数智能设备一样，在完成第一次阅读之前需要进行一些灯光设置。我们的建议是在您实际需要之前设置应用程序和温度计。

首先，从应用程序商店下载 Kinsa Health 应用程序。 Kinsa Health 应用程序免费且易于导航。从那里，您必须将应用程序与您的设备配对。接下来，添加将使用该设备的所有家庭成员。

将温度计对准距额头中心一英寸的位置，然后单击温度计按钮即可测量某人的体温。

Kinsa QuickScan 温度计与应用程序对话，指导您完成体温测量过程

然后，您可以将应用程序内弹出的温度读数分配给正确的家庭成员。此外，您可以跟踪症状和药物治疗。

用户可以查看每日用药、剂量、症状和体温的全面时间表。这有助于父母保持一致并了解孩子的进步情况。

某些症状，例如持续发烧，需要设备的指导。例如：如果症状持续几天，与您的医生讨论是个好主意。该日志可以转发给医生以便于阅读。

Kinsa Health QuickScan 温度计 - 功能

在Kinsa 应用程序中，用户可以创建无限的配置文件来存储和跟踪症状、体温读数以及给药的日期/时间。用户可以根据年龄、发烧和症状获得个性化指导。

当症状引起关注时，Kinsa 会将用户转介给 Teladoc 委员会认证的医生。该应用程序显示一个时间表，显示出现症状的时间、服用的药物和剂量。

此外，为了实时了解疾病在哪里传播，Kinsa 会收集您所在地区的匿名体温和症状，并在应用程序内显示社区警报。

在 Kinsa 应用程序上查看当地发病率

我们发现的一个问题是应用程序内的。该应用程序存在一个错误，偶尔会崩溃并需要重新启动。如果您想快速测量生病或挑剔的孩子的体温，这会很烦人。

我们的另一个不满是该应用程序的最初使用。温度计会要求您连接到应用程序，然后才能进行第一次读数。如果您想要快速阅读，这可能会令人沮丧。

然而，一旦您将温度计连接到 Kinsa Health 应用程序，温度计将在温度计屏幕上显示未来的读数，而无需打开该应用程序。

另一个考虑因素是下拉菜单并未列出所有可能的症状。如果您遇到未列出的症状，您将无法记录正确的症状。手动记录症状而不是使用下拉菜单会很有帮助。

Kinsa Health QuickScan 温度计 - 谁会受益

QuickScan 是一款坚固的温度计，我们认为大多数人手头上有一个都会受益。它特别适合那些必须在半夜跟踪症状的有孩子的人。

如果多个家庭成员照顾生病的孩子，该应用程序可以显示症状和剂量的时间表，这样就不会给予重复的剂量。

时间线显示每个家庭成员的剂量、症状和发烧数据

这款温度计符合 HSA/FSA 标准，因此请检查您的健康保险，看看是否可以从 Kinsa Health 商店免费购买一个。此外，Kinsa 还与学校合作，向家长通报教室中可能存在的病毒。

Kinsa Health QuickScan 温度计 - 为药柜购买一个

对于那些经常使用“健康”应用程序并喜欢全面了解自己健康状况的人来说，这款温度计是一款很棒的小工具。其非接触式设计对于学校和企业来说是一种明智且注重健康的选择。

总而言之，这款产品名副其实。 Kinsa QuickScan 具有简单的应用程序、2 秒温度读数、医疗指导、FSA/HAS 资格和 FDA 批准，值得在您的药柜货架上永久占有一席之地。

Kinsa Health QuickScan 温度计 - 优点

  • 设备和 Kinsa 应用程序易于使用
  • 非接触式
  • FDA 批准
  • 符合 FSA/HSA 资格
  • 健康指导
  • 健康应用程序同步
  • 症状、药物和发烧追踪

Kinsa Health QuickScan 温度计 - 缺点

  • 首次使用前必须连接到应用程序
  • 从有限的症状列表中进行症状追踪
  • 应用程序偶尔崩溃

评分：3.5 分（满分 5 分）

哪里可以购买 Kinsa Health QuickScan 温度计

您可以从 Amazon 购买温度计，价格为36.99 美元，也可以直接从 Kinsa Health 购买，价格为49.99 美元。

; Sun, 09 Jul 2023 15:46:14 GMT https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/07/09/deals-99-airpods-gen-2-150-off-m2-pro-mac-mini-350-gopro-hero11-black https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/07/09/deals-99-airpods-gen-2-150-off-m2-pro-mac-mini-350-gopro-hero11-black AppleInsider Staff Apple Vision Pro won't be an iPad-level business for quite a while

人们对 Apple Vision Pro 的初始销售预期较低，据称由于生产困难以及对成本的普遍抱怨，苹果已经削减了该耳机的初始订单。对于苹果来说，这不一定是一个大问题，因为有报告坚称，无论如何，耳机臂都需要很长时间才能对苹果的业务产生重大影响。

周日，马克·古尔曼 (Mark Gurman) 在彭博社的“Power On” 时事通讯中撰文，比较了苹果帝国不同部门的增长，并认为相比之下，Vision Pro 的增长可能会非常缓慢。

在 YouTube 上订阅 AppleInsider
在 YouTube 上订阅 AppleInsider

古尔曼写道， iPhone和iPad “几乎立即成为重要的收入贡献者”，第一代 iPhone 在不到三个月的时间里售出了 100 万台，消除了人们对定价的担忧，到 2009 年创造了苹果总收入的三分之一。iPad 管理了 18上市一年后占总销售收入的%。

古尔曼认为， Apple Watch 的起步要慢得多，但它已经成为“业务的重要组成部分”。虽然苹果公司尚未将 Apple Watch 的销量统计到 iPhone 和 iPad 等自己的类别中，但它仍然是可穿戴设备、家居和配件领域的一部分，每年带来约 400 亿美元的收入。

对于 Apple Vision Pro，Gurman 的理由是，非常有限的发布时间表使其销售轨迹比 Apple Watch 慢得多。 Apple Watch 在 9 个国家/地区的售价为 349 美元，而 Apple Vision Pro 的售价是其十倍，而且仅在美国上市。

Apple Vision Pro 在 2024 年初推出后的几个月内不会扩展到其他国家，并且可能要到 2025 年才会上市。

文化与金融

古尔曼还回顾了历史进行比较，指出社会已经习惯了手表 200 年，因此采用健身追踪器或智能手表是微不足道的。重型耳机需要单独的外部电池并且需要戴在脸上，这构成了一个挑战，因为市场上还没有几个世纪的类似产品。

古尔曼表示，在财务方面，苹果几年前最初的第一年目标是“数百万美元”，很快就达到了 400 万，然后是 100 万。目前第一年的销售预测为 400,000 至 500,000 辆。

耳机和处方镜片等附加产品的平均售价为 3,700 美元，如果达到最低预期，苹果公司第一年的收入将达到约 15 亿美元。 Gurman 认为，要达到 iPad 的水平，耳机的销量需要增长 20 倍，达到每年约 800 万台。

尽管有望推出更便宜的型号，但达到 iPad 收入水平“在可预见的未来几乎是不可能的”。古尔曼认为，即使即将推出更便宜的型号，大多数人也会坚持选择“更安全的选择” Mac或 iPad，至少在苹果推出更接近眼镜的版本之前是这样。

Apple Vision Pro 对于该公司来说是一个缓慢发展的概念并不新鲜，因为过去曾讨论过它对于该公司来说更像是一个长期游戏。

AppleInsider 之前曾撰文指出，最初的耳机显然并不“适合所有人”，而且它是一款理想的产品，旨在让更广泛的消费者群体相信他们可能会在未来使用它或未来的迭代产品。 。

再加上技术的进步让东西变得更小、更快、更便宜、更好，而且苹果拥有充足的资源和现金来玩等待游戏，没有人能真正指望苹果的耳机项目能够成为 iPhone 级别的畅销产品球棒。

; Sat, 08 Jul 2023 20:05:22 GMT https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/07/08/first-foundation-episode-streams-free-on-youtube-on-monday https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/07/08/first-foundation-episode-streams-free-on-youtube-on-monday Malcolm Owen 24-hour Apple Watch challenge: Can it replace the iPhone?

在我们深入探讨挑战的实质内容之前，有一些关于我的挑战的后勤工作的家务事项。我的 Apple Watch 上有蜂窝网络套餐，因此当我把iPhone抛在一边时，我仍然可以在 Apple Watch 上获取提醒、数据和其他所有内容。

如果您的 Apple Watch 上没有数据套餐，那么没有 iPhone 就会变得更加困难，因为您无法使用Siri 、接收消息、接听电话或执行其他操作。

The challenge is also supposed to be about replacing my iPhone. That doesn't prevent me from using other devices that don't compete with Apple Watch, such as my Mac or iPad , though I did try to limit their use as much as possible.

Subscribe to AppleInsider on YouTube
Subscribe to AppleInsider on YouTube

I'm also using the Apple Watch Ultra . Compared to other versions of the Apple Watch, this has the longest-lasting battery life and can recharge rapidly.

I started the day with a full charge and made it through the whole day and the following night — a whole 24 hours — without charging up.

If you're doing this regularly, you'd need to ensure you set time throughout the day to power up.

One issue I knew I'd have to contend with that others don't is that I'm a type 1 diabetic and wear a CGM. My Dexcom G7 connects to my iPhone to give me near real-time readings of my blood sugar level so that I can take the appropriate amount of insulin needed with meals.

Dexcom CGM only goes to iPhone

The Dexcom G7 currently only connects to the iPhone, which will forward the data to the Apple Watch. When I left the house without my iPhone, I got no readings from my CGM.

Dexcom says it is working on an update to the G7 that will allow direct Apple Watch connection, but until then, I was out of luck. Since using a CGM is somewhat niche, we won't go into further detail when evaluating my day.

When I wake up in the morning...

Starting the day, I roll out of bed after I dismiss the sounding alarm vibrating on my wrist. I always wear my Apple Watch to bed for sleep tracking and the ability to have my Apple Watch assist in getting me out of bed thanks to its Taptic Engine.

Sleep tracking with Apple Watch

Instead of looking at my iPhone for my morning summary, I looked at the notifications on my Apple Watch and checked my emails. I did have one that I wanted to respond to right away, which meant using the small on-screen keyboard.

The keyboard isn't as bad as it was, and swiping to type is reliable. Still, it felt like it took me three times as long as it would on my iPhone.

Typing with the new watchOS keyboard

I hopped out of bed to make my morning coffee, and while I waited on the brew, my instinct was to scour social media. Except, this is much harder with Apple Watch as your sole device.

There's no native Twitter or TikTok client for watchOS . I use Chirp, which works in a pinch for Twitter, so I saw what was trending on its version of my home feed.

With my coffee in hand, I set out to get work done.

Working 9 to 5

My work day was the easiest portion of the challenge as I simply used my Mac more. I'm not going to lie — my first move was heading to Twitter for a better view of the day's ongoings.

With my Mac, I checked in on Slack — something else I can't do on my watch — and my email. The latter is possible with watchOS, but seeing only one or two emails at a time feels limiting for real work.

Throughout the day, I used my Mac for texting, Slack messages, video editing, photo editing, and answering questions on social media. The usual rigamaroll.

I'd probably have done much of this on my phone while walking around the set or filming, but I was more tethered to my notebook than usual. At times, it felt good to be more focused with my Mac, but I also felt like I couldn't work whenever I stepped away.

Hold the wheel then drive

In the afternoon, I had some errands that needed to be checked off my to-do list, so I hopped in the car. No CarPlay today, though, and I had to listen to SiriusXM through my car radio instead of catching up on podcasts.

I could have used my AirPods directly with my Apple Watch to stream music, podcasts, or books from my Audible library, but I didn't bring them so I was out of luck.

Apple Pay on Apple Watch

My first stop was Petco to grab my online order for dog food and water for my salt tank. My watch tapped me as I got a message from my partner asking if I could grab some teething bones for the pups.

After picking out a bag of natural toothbrush bones, I headed to checkout and completed the purchase via Apple Pay . I did have my wallet, but it's nice to tap to pay when possible — and safer.

I was dragging, so on my way home, I made a detour to Starbucks. Once more, I could have paid using my wallet, but I wanted my Starbucks stars.

Paying for Starbucks with the watchOS app

Starbucks has a watchOS app that shows my remaining dollar balance and allows the barista to scan the barcode to complete the transaction. Easy enough through the drive-through.

While I waited for my cold brew, I did run into another Apple Watch limitation that drives me crazy — the News app. Apple News on Apple Watch shows you only the top five headlines and the lede, no more.

Apple News on Apple Watch

If you want to continue reading a story, it pushes you over to the iOS app which I didn't have access to. I had to just sit there and be patient while I waited, with no phone to distract me.

Be runnin' up that road

Before dinner, I wanted to get a workout in. I went outside for a quick (very quick) jog. This time I did remember to connect my AirPods to listen to music while I ran.

Starting a cycling workout on Apple Watch

Once I made it back, I hopped onto our spinning bike for a bike ride too. I am running watchOS 7 so it is nice to see the new cycling features.

Apple Home controls on Apple Watch

Before biking, I used Siri to set my working scene which closed our living room blinds and turned on the living room lights. If I didn't have my Apple Watch I'd still be able to use my HomePods though.

As I started cooking dinner, I initially started using the timers on my iPhone but I quickly realized that the HomePod was better suited. No need to use my watch at all there, even if it was my task for the day.

I did run into an issue when I couldn't look up a recipe substitute though. I won't say I cheated, but I did have to use my iPad to do a bit of culinary research.

So take it easy

As I started to wind down for the night it was the most difficult part of the day to be without my iPhone. Messaging was more cumbersome on my watch over an extended period, I couldn't read the news or browse social.

I felt disconnected from the digital world. That doesn't necessarily have to be a bad thing as it can be a bit freeing to ditch the constant glow of our phones.

There was no way I could sit on the couch, consumed by my smartphone but instead spent some time in our garden, chatting, playing with the baby, and other offline activities. I did those things before, but I probably spent more time doing them with no digital alternative.

Remote app for Apple TV is only OK

As we hit the bed for the night, I tried using my watch to control the Apple TV and while possible, it isn't as convenient as the Siri Remote or my iPhone.

Finally, I used my Apple Watch to set my good night scene and enabled the sleep focus.

Making it through the day wasn't as difficult as I imagined it would be but it still isn't something I could do each day. Some tasks are plain out tougher to do and some are downright impossible.

Looking back at it all it is impressive how much the Apple Watch can now do, even if there are still a few gaps to shore up.

; Sat, 08 Jul 2023 13:48:55 GMT https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/07/08/deals-900-off-m1-14-inch-macbook-pro-45-off-samsung-m8-32-inch-smart-monitor-37-off-amazon-echo-frames https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/07/08/deals-900-off-m1-14-inch-macbook-pro-45-off-samsung-m8-32-inch-smart-monitor-37-off-amazon-echo-frames AppleInsider Staff Be careful with emoji, because they are legally binding in Canada

The King's Bench for Saskatchewan issued a summary judgment on June 8 that could have serious implications for users of messaging services. While they may not necessarily be seen as serious communications, it's possible for responses to be taken as agreeing to the terms of a contract.

In the lawsuit between South West Terminal and Achter Land & Cattle, reports the Guardian , a grain buyer in South West Terminal sent a mass text message to clients in March 2021, saying the company was willing to buy 86 tonnes of flax for C$17 ($12.73) per bushel.

Farmer Chris Achter spoke to the buyer over the phone about the request. The buyer then sent an image of a contract to Achter about the delivery of flax in November of that year, asking the farmer to "please confirm flax contract" in the message.

Achter responded with a thumbs-up emoji, and that's where the confusion lies. The farmer claimed in the lawsuit that the symbol was intended to mean he had received the contract in the message, while the buyer believed it was Achter agreeing to the contract.

"I deny that he accepted the thumbs-up emoji as a digital signature of the incomplete contract," Achter told the court. "I did not have time to review the Flax Contract and merely wanted to indicate that I did receive his text message."

South West Terminal offered that there had been previous instances where contracts were handled and agreed upon with the emoji.

Ultimately, because of the confusion, the farmer failed to make the delivery to South West.

Justice Timothy Keene mentions in the ruling that the disagreement on what the emoji meant led to a "far flung search for the equivalent of the Rosetta Stone in cases from Israel, New York State, and some tribunals in Canada, etc. to unearth what [the emoji] means."

The court eventually determined that the thumbs-up emoji is a "non-traditional means to sign' a document but nevertheless under these circumstances this was a valid way to convey the two purposes of a signature."

While the affair gives one emoji a legally-definable meaning in one court in Canada at least, the judge doesn't believe it would "open up the flood gates" to other emojis being interpreted in such legal means. However, he also said the court cannot and shouldn't "attempt to stem the tide of technology and common usage" of emojis.

Due to the ruling by Justice Keene, Achter has been ordered to pay C$82,000 ($61,442) to South West Terminal for failing to fulfill the contract.
